subSections.title: Kanji
Readings
Etymology 1
subSections.text: Abbreviation of {{l|ja|枌板}}, {{l|ja|削板|tr=''sogiita''}}, itself a compound of {{m|ja|削ぎ|tr=sogi||shaving, chipping|pos=stem noun form of verb {{l|ja|削ぐ|tr=sogu}}, “to chip or shave off”}} + {{m|ja|板|tr=ita||board, plank}}.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|そぎ|hhira=そき}}

# a [[wooden]] [[shake#Noun|shake]] or large [[shingle]]: a thin [[board]] or [[plank]] of wood chipped or shaved off a larger piece and used as [[roofing]] or [[siding]]

subSections.title: Synonyms
subSections.text: * {{l|ja|削ぎ板}}, {{l|ja|削板}}, {{l|ja|殺ぎ板}}, {{l|ja|殺板}}, {{l|ja|枌板|tr={{l|ja|そぎいた}}, ''{{l|ja|sc=Latn|sogiita}}''; {{l|ja|そぎた}}, ''{{l|ja|sc=Latn|sogita}}''}}

subSections.title: Related terms
subSections.text:
* {{l|ja|杮|tr={{l|ja|こけら}}, ''{{l|ja|sc=Latn|kokera}}''}}: wood chips; a [[shingle]] (smaller than a ''sogi'')
* {{l|ja|杮葺|tr={{l|ja|こけらぶき}}, ''{{l|ja|sc=Latn|kokerabuki}}''}}: [[shingling]]; a [[shingled]] [[roof]]

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|まつ}}

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|松}}: {{lb|ja|rare|sort=まつ}} a [[pine]] tree

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: Seldom used. The spelling {{l|ja|松}} is much more common.
